slide.title: PEAR package manager
slide.blurb: The PEAR package manager (%*pear*%) is the swiss-army tool for:

list.bullet: Installing, upgrading and uninstalling packages from PEAR, Horde, etc.
Building PECL extensions (e.g.: apd, xmms, etc.)
Getting information on local and remote packages.
Validating and creating your own distributable packages.
Managing PEAR CVS releases: tagging, signing, etc.

slide.blurb: And the cool thing is that it is (most likely) already installed on your system (PHP version 4.3.0 or newer).
It is also smart, it groks XML-RPC (like when talking to PEAR's or Horde's site), HTTP (when using a full URL), or even a local tarball on your disk.

example.title: ... and if you do not have it

slide.example: $ wget http://pear.php.net/go-pear $ php -f go-pear (... follow the instructions ...)
